_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Pipeline Transportation of Refined Petroleum Products

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The safety of our employees, contract employees, customers, neighbors and the environment is a core business value and an important priority. Reducing the impact of our operations on the environment is also a priority. NuStar Energy LP is committed to achieving Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) excellence throughout the organization.

NuStar management has also agreed to correct in a timely manner all hazards identified through self inspections, employee reports, accident investigations, or any other means with interim protection as necessary.

We will provide the results of self-inspections and accident investigation to our employees upon request.

We will continuously seek areas for improvement and ways to raise our employees level of awareness regarding all aspects of safety and health.

The McPherson Station was built and put into service in 1974. The Butane addition was added to the station in 2007. The facility was built to store and transport butane (RMP regulated substance), refined products and a Liquid Mixture (LM) of the two products. The butane, refined products and the LM are delivered, via an 8" and an 10" pipeline, to the McPherson Station from the NuStar Terminals in Augusta and El Dorado Kansas. The 1,680,000 lbs. of butane, which exceeds the 10,000 lbs. threshold quantity (TQ) of the OSHA PSM requirements, is stored in, one of four, pressurized bullet tanks. The LM is stored in one of the pressurized bullet tanks. The butane is transferred out of the station via pipelines to other NuStar Terminals downstream.

The McPherson Facility complies with many different regulatory agencies, which include, but not limited to;

- OSHAs Process Safety Management (PSM) Program (1910.119) of Highly Hazardous Chemicals.

- OSHAs Emergency Action Plan Regulation, 29 CFR 1910.38(c).

- OSHAs HAZWOPER Regulation, 29 CFR 1910.120.

- Federal Oil Pollution Act of 1990: U.S. DOT Final Rule for Transportation Related On-Shore Facilities as publis

hed in 49 CFR Part 194 (Response Plans for Onshore Oil Pipelines).

- Federal Oil Pollution Act of 1990: U.S. EPA Final Rule for non-Transportation Related on-Shore Facilities as published 

  in 40 CFR Part 112.

- DOT Part 195 Transportation of Hazardous Liquids by Pipeline.

- DOT Part 199 Drug and Alcohol Testing.

The McPherson Facility conducts two equipment deployment drills (one un-announced) a year, Quarterly Qualified Individual (QI) drills and an annual table top drill is performed during the annual HAZWOPER training. 

We have an excellent five year accident free history. We have had no accidental releases in the last five years and in fact the McPherson Station was built in 1974 and to this date we have had zero butane releases. 

The McPherson Emergency Response Program works together with the McPherson Fire Department and the NCRA Refinery Fire Brigade. The McPherson employees are not first responders, but have received training in the notification process of the McPherson and NCRA Fire Department (first responder). The employees also participate in an annual evacuation drill, in the event an evacuation is required. 

Various employees at the McPherson Station have received CPR training, and all employees have received annual HAZWOPER training. Numerous other drills are conducted at the McPherson Station as stated previously.

Safety is the #1 core value of our company. Whether in performing everyday work or in the planning and maintenance of project work, safety is top priority. Some of the improvements towards safety have been: 

- Management and employees have teamed together to achieve the OSHA VPP Star award and have recertified for this award. In this pursuit, there are several changes to improve safety and some of them are;

 - Quarterly Hazard Identification Audits

 - Electrical cord quarterly inspection program

 - First Use Vehicle inspection program

 - Lifting sling(s) quarterly inspection program

- The regional office is implemented an

electronic MOC process, which will help expedite the approval process and provide a more in-depth safety analysis of the proposed change. 

- An electronic SDS (MSDS) approval process has been completed which allows users at any of our sites the ability to view any SDS through the company intranet. 

- Our Lock-Out/Tag-Out program has gone through an overhaul and training has been completed throughout the company. 

- The entire region uses the company CEM (Certified Environmental Management) to perform the industrial hygiene testing.

- NuStar has implemented automatic tank gauging which alleviates the need to climb the tanks on a daily basis.
